intro.p: The American Community Survey (ACS) is an annual survey done by the US Census Bureau. Information from the survey generates data that help inform how trillions of dollars in federal funds are distributed each year. The ACS gathers a wide variety of data including information about whether American own or rent their homes, how they commute to work, what their employment status is, as well as dozens of other topics.

One set of questions on the ACS is about how people commute to work. The data table below summarizes four methods of commuting, broken down into three age groups. Please use the table below to answer the questions listed.
